lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* This is the main class of the Duke application, responsible for handling user input and managing tasks.
private static final Storage storage = new Storage(FILE_PATH);
* Creates a new Duke instance, initializes the UI, and loads tasks from storage.
* Starts the Duke application and runs the command loop.
* Main method to start the Duke application.
* This class represents custom exceptions specific to the Duke application.
* It extends the Exception class and is used to handle application-specific error messages.
* Creates a new DukeException with the specified error message.
* @param message The error message associated with the exception.
* This class handles the user interface for the Duke application, including input and output.
* It provides methods for reading user commands and displaying messages.
* Creates a new Ui instance with BufferedReader for input and PrintWriter for output.
* Reads a user command from the input.
* @return The user command entered by the user.
* @throws IOException If there is an issue reading the input.
* Displays a horizontal line as a separator.
* Displays a message to the user.
* Displays an error message indicating a problem with loading tasks from a file.
* Displays a goodbye message to the user.
showMessage("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Displays an error message to the user.
* @param error The error message to display.
* Displays a message indicating a task has been deleted.
* @param removedTask  The Task object that has been removed.
public void showDeletedMessage(TaskList tasks, Task removedTask) {
writer.println("Noted. I've removed this task:\n  " + removedTask);
writer.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + taskWord + " in the list.");
* Closes the PrintWriter used for output.
* Displays a welcome message to the user.
showMessage("What can I do for you?");
* Displays a message indicating a task has been added.
writer.println("Got it. I've added this task:\n  " + tasks.get(tasks.size() - 1));
writer.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + taskWord + " in the list.");
* Retrieves the PrintWriter for writing output.
* Displays a message indicating a task has been marked as done.
* @param task The Task object that has been marked as done.
writer.println("This task is already marked as done:\n  " + task);
writer.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n  " + task);
* Displays a message indicating a task has been marked as not done.
* @param task The Task object that has been marked as not done.
writer.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n  " + task);
writer.println("This task is already marked as not done:\n  " + task);
* This class represents a command to add tasks to the Duke application.
* It handles the addition of Todo, Deadline, and Event tasks based on user input.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException, IOException {
throw new DukeException("Please enter a valid task type.");
throw new DukeException("The description of a " + taskType + " cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("The deadline time or task name is missing.");
throw new DukeException("The event time details or event times are missing.");
throw new DukeException("The event description is missing.");
throw new DukeException("Incomplete event time details. Both start and end times are required.");
throw new DukeException("The event start time is missing.");
throw new DukeException("The event end time is missing.");
throw new DukeException("Please enter a valid task type.");
* This class is the base class for all command-related classes in the Duke application.
* It defines the common interface and properties that all command classes must have.
* Executes the command based on user input.
* @param tasks   The TaskList containing the list of tasks.
* @param ui      The Ui object for user interaction.
* @param storage The Storage object for saving and loading tasks.
* @throws DukeException If an error related to Duke application occurs.
* @throws IOException   If there is an input/output error while saving or loading tasks.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException, IOException;
* Checks if the command is an exit command.
* @return True if the command is an exit command, otherwise false.
* This class represents a command to delete a task from the Duke application.
* It allows the user to remove a task by specifying its index in the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException, IOException {
throw new DukeException("Task number " + (index + 1) + " does not exist.");
throw new DukeException("Please enter a valid task number to delete.");
* This class represents a command to exit the Duke application.
* It allows the user to terminate the application gracefully.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* This class represents a command to find tasks in the Duke application.
* It searches for tasks that contain a specific keyword in their descriptions.
* Creates a new FindCommand instance with the specified keyword.
* @param fullCommand The full command string entered by the user.
* Executes the FindCommand to search for tasks that contain the keyword in their descriptions.
* @param tasks   The TaskList containing the list of tasks.
* @param ui      The Ui object for user interaction.
* @param storage The Storage object for saving and loading tasks.
* @throws DukeException If there is an issue executing the command.
* @throws IOException  If there is an issue saving the tasks to the file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException, IOException {
throw new DukeException("Please provide a keyword to search for.");
// Filtering the tasks that contain the keyword in their description

* It allows the user to view the current list of tasks.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* This class represents a command to unmark a task as not done in the Duke application.
* It allows the user to mark a completed task as not done by specifying its index in the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException, IOException {

throw new DukeException("Please enter a valid task number to unmark.");
* This class provides utility methods for parsing date-time strings in various formats.

throw new DukeException("Invalid date-time format. Please use a valid format such as yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm or dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm.");
* This class represents a deadline task in the Duke application.
* It extends the Task class and includes a specific deadline date and time.
* Creates a new Deadline task with the given description and deadline date and time.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by          The deadline date and time.
* @throws DukeException If there is an issue with the task creation.
public Deadline(String description, LocalDateTime by) throws DukeException {
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task, including its type, description, and deadline.
* @return The formatted string representation of the Deadline task.
* This class represents an event task in the Duke application.
* It extends the Task class and includes specific start and end date and time.
* Creates a new Event task with the given description, start date and time, and end date and time.
* @param description The description of the event task.
* @param from        The start date and time of the event.
* @param to          The end date and time of the event.
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {

* @return The formatted string representation of the Event task.
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy, HH:mm");
* This class provides utility methods to parse user input commands and create corresponding Command objects.
* It is used for interpreting user commands in the Duke application.
* Parses the user's full command and returns the corresponding Command object.
* @param fullCommand The full user command to parse.
* @return The Command object corresponding to the parsed user command.
* @throws DukeException If the command is unrecognized or has invalid format.
public static Command parse(String fullCommand) throws DukeException {
* This class handles reading and writing tasks to a storage file in the Duke application.

* Loads tasks from the storage file and returns them as a TaskList.

throw new IOException("Error reading from file: " + filePath, e);
throw new RuntimeException("Error parsing date-time: " + e.getMessage(), e);

throw new IOException("Unable to create directories: " + parentDir.getAbsolutePath());
throw new IOException("Unable to create new file: " + file.getAbsolutePath());

* Converts a Task object to a string format suitable for saving in the storage file.

* It includes a description and a boolean flag to indicate whether the task is done or not.

public Task removeTask(int index) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("duke.task.Task number out of range.");
* Returns the list of tasks in the TaskList.

writer.println("Here are the " + taskWord + " in your list:");
